27911BB27B5844F5AF45D685E64C2EF8.description: Reflect, with some guidance, on new knowledge of Nakoda and its value to self and the wider community.

831B5B90D3004A0B846C74D983184567.description: Determine, with some guidance, personal inquiry and research strengths and language goals.

08DB4D187F574EFBBFFC7E9677241B3B.description: Review and refine, with some guidance, through reflection, feedback and self-assessment.

FF0F8CE2EE8B44ECA3DF2E208F751F3E.description: Reflect, with some guidance, on attainment of personal goals for effective language learning and use.

A1CE15B0369A41DD8B77E1FE8BBE2473.description: Monitor, with some guidance, personal communication goals.

671F06281ECF48F3B37D2392070C67B1.description: Assess own work, with some guidance, for clarity, correctness and impact.

B5A49033BE4B4C5AB8385F5023964424.description: Assess personal strengths and needs within the development of language learning as they relate to family, community and land and set goals for future improvement, with some guidance.

C516DD8B54544A2482B5312AA8A74C91.description: Use criteria and rubrics to evaluate presentations including the purpose, delivery, content, visual aids, body language and facial expressions.

9285BCB4964F48658B4D674188F5C5B7.description: Evaluate and modify own roles in group interactions.

9329B21FDCF648E5B0EAC0F3572BE23E.description: Explain how speaking, listening and viewing are useful tools to clarify thinking, communicate with others and learn.

F9C2232913E84AE8B7606D567FED560C.description: Reflects on factors that influence identity through the use of the Nakoda language.

2F4A0046037544229C7D471E5073BAD0.description: Assess personal strengths and needs within the development of language skills and set goals for future improvement.

54E4E12E459C4673AFF1E8B842680AE5.description: Discuss options using words for possibility, comparison, contrast and cause (e.g., compare and contrast artwork done by Saskatchewan artists or discuss the pros and cons of living in the city).

BEB4848519E34B79A1BED48C750E05E9.description: Give a set of instructions with appropriate sequence, rules, conditions and imperatives such as how to make jam using blueberries or raspberries or how to clean and tan deer hide.

9CFFF4BC780E4283B2BE862A7D78D188.description: Describe or narrate an experience, event or situation (e.g., prepare wild game or educational experiences) with supporting detail.

92EFBD414E6D467FB2D4A29AC8953724.description: Use research findings to demonstrate effective forms for recording and presenting such as digital platforms, video archives or children’s literature.

703DBABEA3EF4227BE715398F586B113.description: Perform language functions, with some guidance, to produce discourse in Nakoda.

48C42E70C00147DFAA26760AD7EB4EC0.description: Manipulate information (e.g., gather, record, process, organize, scan) acquired through research to make meaning.

BDB6A73C82A346779E55FAC38FE025CF.description: Approach cultural resource people, with guidance, using appropriate protocol for collecting information.

11CC1C7558FC4EAFA0A1D080AA6FA386.description: Identify possible sources of information for research such as resource people, written resources and media resources.

5E3C5DC87C9C43B6BE2C38B223FEF393.description: Form possible research or inquiry questions.

5DE7066DA9534C43A3A193A00FDDBCFA.description: Identify a need or purpose for collecting cultural information in consultation with Elders.

DE881B9F7C0E44A5AC55B87C0F046264.description: Perform language functions in Nakoda, with some guidance, for research.

D7AE8CDCCC2C4000A76EAF11F89E8D7A.description: Compare self to a character or situation in moral stories.

08E43E5B615B4F19A9D09A74A3ABF6C5.description: Demonstrate recognition of language techniques used for effectiveness of presentation such as voice or the use of metaphors.

D9BD95808B7A42358B754645583238AA.description: Search for meaning in the unspoken discourse such as ellipses, symbols or metaphors.

3019A5E52A7E4BF09833F85020D805EA.description: Demonstrate comprehension of the main idea and details by outlining and summarizing, paraphrasing and answering questions after listening, viewing or reading discourse.

D22525D01230438E81FC550E2F706989.description: Engage in previewing or listening activities that provide background knowledge and recall what is already known about the discourse.

2859576905DE49E89B96165D57E67820.description: Interpret discourse in Nakoda by choosing the appropriate language function, with some guidance.

654503CD11DD49818F3A51764F1301DB.description: Demonstrate and use language families and dialects-systematic sound differences and reasons for differences in vocabulary.

250AADBDFC864CC8B326979A4EC8F15A.description: Use language and other protocols governing relationships between and among people during ceremonies and special events.

FCAF0C8000A547ACAB267C14BFDFEAAC.description: Use inclusive language to welcome guests into the home, school or community.

F7A3CCCE086D4673BC528DDDF8DC90EC.description: Perform language functions, with some guidance, to socialize and celebrate in Nakoda.

45A5A5B90E7A462498C825483E0F0516.description: Pose questions and ask for repetition to clarify understanding

35614EAE71924E6EAF6F08A87463FCE6.description: Seek information to help formulate personal understanding.

BA3F484CE6D44C2EA0797BCBD8AAFB90.description: Organize and clarify personal thinking and ideas.

6DD6B89FFD2042B0BA2EA7971B318E6D.description: Use questions to understand new ideas.

C271DF1935024734B09E3589E855FDE5.description: Use Nakoda to persuade or convince.

CBA5862C458B47BA962764637B7E48B4.description: Discuss plans (e.g., going to the library, going for coffee, meeting for volleyball).

411A4780DEB642A98CB105BE8208F097.description: Perform language functions, with some guidance, to receive and give information in Nakoda.

370BFDF0744E42CA9769F346B5D65FB3.description: Practise a variety of patterns in texts.

6E478A62635A4EC69AC311D12D093CF0.description: Apply a variety of conventions to structured texts (e.g., titles, poetry, riddles or jokes).

1958419F6F734456B8491D87B017BC47.description: Select a variety of short oral texts on unfamiliar topics in guided situations.

312918F185A245DDBAF8268C7ACD301F.description: Use simple linking devices such as štén ‘if, when’, žécen ‘so that’ appropriately in spontaneous speech to create a sense of flow.

A89CA945F1E4412FB755EC0D056ADE36.description: Express some logical relations in discourse.

8B8AE4A9495B405BBB9E293BA97CB3FB.description: Convey an idea in discourse with a logical sequence of events and with simple but effective detail.

E0FDFD765A9246648F558608F9751928.description: Communicate coherently in Nakoda, with some guidance.

33151AD4D07B46F58D422844E9D6CF68.description: Produce basic phrases, short sentences and questions using learned vocabulary and simple language structures.

51EC8A0BC9194973ABD6963007B3F7EF.description: Participate in a simple conversation with a Nakoda speaker using repetition and explanation.

A3AE104090AC4EEF90BC26BBCBD7F868.description: Manage simple, routine interactions with ease and ask for clarification when necessary.

764A95F09F5C4821959E0BB71F19BCE2.description: Produce speech at a normal or slower than normal rate that requires some repetition to be understood by a first language speaker.

6CD8504893864685A8D9AD668427C1D8.description: Communicate proficiently in Nakoda, with some guidance.

90E2122602BC4CA5BC2A793306083AD3.description: Produce a variety of short, simple oral texts in guided and unguided situations.

A2E2F28DF9BD4F12AB1DEA45B0D87CA5.description: Use a wider range of common verbal affixes with relative accuracy.

5D1AD45DFA61464DACF1A612AEAC7D17.description: Produce sentences containing a subordinate clause.

DD55827BA1424E86AE895E881C30CC11.description: Use specific vocabulary associated with a range of common topics such as computer (?yáwe?t?y?) or phone (mas’ápabi).

E2C699E4BB4C4EABA10535935D96B245.description: Produce sounds of language with enough clarity to prevent misunderstandings of common words.

2C8DE80A490A4FA4BEEF963243908BE0.description: Communicate accurately, with some guidance, using syntactical and semantical connections of Nakoda.

196DB5D313524EDF9B461C7421EAB715.description: Identify and develop own strengths related to Nakoda language and culture.

21DE9D626CA54092A845E0418D8254E4.description: Identify language and cultural role models and what makes them unique.

0D5B3BAF72F1420AAFF1F0B7928433AA.description: Work with language mentors (e.g., parents, friends, peers, Elders) to monitor and improve own learning.

31F294A4CAB44649ADD90E7A602B04CD.description: Identify effective mental techniques to improve learning Nakoda.

34A8236717DF4D86A8A75220BE77E19F.description: Demonstrate willingness to take risks and to try unfamiliar tasks and approaches.

499E28E9750A48FD8D6338262567B34D.description: Ask for clarification or repetition to aid understanding.

98E6A7EB39F344A9AC4F666124B0A8EE.description: Repeat and use new words and expressions occurring in conversation with others.

CA7E539140D24CDF8AA38310ED87EF83.description: Identify problems that may hinder successful completion of a task and seek solutions.

778DD645BC774334AF435EFA82A5C61D.description: Demonstrate how strategies may assist with texts containing unknown elements.

BEAE004420F54D0CB3ADE768806E8309.description: Demonstrate awareness of learning through direct exposure to Nakoda by asking questions when someone is speaking.

46300010DF3841C783B912090EE6272D.description: Use key content words or context clues to follow an extended text.

3A5E80B1A7584A0C90D31E8DDECB9C23.description: Place new words or expressions in a context to make them easier to remember.

6C4457A3A52341A3B25D558427A8DB0E.description: Use graphic representations (e.g., word maps, mind maps, diagrams, charts) to make information easier to understand and to remember.

A1D3AB86386B492BAB756A3B64DF53BB.description: Identify and justify the evidence on which inferences are based.

F81E4C0A6D3C4FBB965F48DEC6F1EE4E.description: Make personal notes when hearing useful language.

32F1CEAB9BF94AC88E6F66E98503D00A.description: Seek opportunities to use or hear the language.

06200B8A59FD474D97C5BE1E26EC2DDB.description: Use reference materials and language speakers to help in clarifying a message.

F899C8D4F7CA44FB8E8A410A3ECBE2DF.description: Use reference materials and language speakers to help in clarifying a message.

0BD9E1AF1A124BD097E48133DA6A61AE.description: Use grammatical knowledge to correct errors or to improve language.

5EB542FBAA56436D9F25D04F885771B9.description: Distinguish relevant information from irrelevant information when trying to understand a speech or difficult conversation.

82F1D4715E93497D86F804C50FEB7C8B.description: Decide in advance what to listen for.

A72CC25AEDF24FBA9D19CB0B9F78E2DA.description: Develop and use various strategies to enhance the meaning of learning and communication.

7423647BDA724B5883024254507A740A.description: Present an oral narrative or other creative text and accompany it with a visual, kinesthetic or oral presentation (e.g., poem put to music, script or dialogue acted out, give instructions on how to do a particular task).

3F7CB2E131BD4386B18292791DD7477B.description: Write notes and present orally to share basic information from inquiry or from a personal or digital source such as a short interview, weather report or short film.

704D0EEB13C5498CBE6454294D4BAD49.description: Share oral and written reflections on personal experiences or Nakoda worldview.

2A4A41C3FEF146BE849C486921C93137.description: Retell parts of oral narratives, orally and in written form, combined with various mediums of expression, such as dance, puppetry, art or drama.

3A8BC04003BB4AFDAC78C2C3AADE2ADE.description: Communicate thoughts, ideas and feelings for specific purposes and audiences through a variety of verbal and visual media in guided situations.

CC369471B99544E3A4228BC4B4E02491.description: Produce text on familiar topics, providing detail to support main point, in guided situations.

9C53E516B83D4C52A7F7E4917C038006.description: Produce, with some guidance, simple oral and written texts on familiar topics in Nakoda.

7BD3408965444D9DBB251E22B7B2950C.description: Read and interpret a descriptive passage of text or a detailed set of instructions for a process, supported with occasional informative illustrations.

FB666911A9194221A86E7CF26B4B006F.description: Read and interpret simple excerpts from stories from the oral tradition supported with occasional informative illustrations, photos or other visual representations.

C652579CC7A0449FA0A4A260E6D26905.description: Identify the purpose of texts (e.g., describe, retell, persuade, entertain, instruct).

FAEF7CC4EB8242939CB01E0D90C8D2D9.description: Listen to and interpret some of the proceedings of community meetings regarding topics relevant to cultural areas of study, such as meetings with Elders, band council meetings or school committee meetings.

334CDBF04196477088857DDF03FE194A.description: Interpret and respond to contemporary Nakoda reflections expressed in a variety of mediums, such as documentaries on a topic of choice or modern Nakoda art, dance, drama and music.

A7E06EB9D6D24333AE533C216ACB6923.description: Interpret and respond to traditional narratives relating to areas of Nakoda worldview, such as histories, moral stories, songs, informational texts and entertaining stories from electronic or print mediums.

292C6FB53B654EF996EFCC171E161349.description: Construct meaning, with some guidance, of a variety of Nakoda simple oral and written fiction and non-fiction texts on familiar topics.

70372BC10713406FAEF81BC287008B76.description: Inquires with Elders or cultural resource people about the Nakoda worldview to learn about the history, past practices and past customs.

BA2D18CC39A948ABA664B1E785527605.description: Interact with members of the community in acts of service to the community, such as helping with the preparation of activities, programming for community radio, television or print media

89076271087448CFA393C62115C8B8BF.description: Participate in community events, such as winter festival, language festival, dance competitions or music festivals.

D6091FF4EF304DC69C42A1533990ADBC.description: Interact with members of the community and Elders while participating in culture camps.

FE3153E8883D4D76AD59A882687D3BDB.description: Interact with Elders or cultural resource people to learn cultural skills in the learners’ natural surroundings.

269DB16545B74F43AD7897D9D31D450C.description: Communicate interactively in Nakoda, with some guidance, to experience the natural and constructed environments of the community.
